Reserved field. 0x0 when read. Writes ignored.

Mailbox full interrupt. Active HIGH. Cleared on read. This interrupt is set when mailbox becomes full which means there is no more space for messages sent from Host processor to internal uCPU and when this interrupt is enabled in MAILBOX_INT_MASK_p register. It is set when mailbox_full bit transitions from 0 to 1.

Mailbox not-empty interrupt. Active HIGH. Cleared on read. This interrupt is set when mailbox becomes not-empty which means there is a response in the mailbox available to read by the Host processer and when interrupt is enabled in MAILBOX_INT_MASK_p register. It is set when mailbox_empty bit transitions from 1 to 0.
Reserved field. 0x0 when read. Writes ignored.

Encoder 1 external diagnostic test enable. When asserted, a corruption is injected in the external diagnostic reference module which generate an external diagnostic support module fault. To perform external diagnostic test this bit must be set first and then one of the bits 7-4 must be set. Both must be a separate writes. NOTE: This bit cannot be set when bypess, encoder, decoder or 8b10b tests are performed.

Encoder 0 external diagnostic test enable. When asserted, a corruption is injected in the external diagnostic reference module which generate an external diagnostic support module fault. To perform external diagnostic test this bit must be set first and then one of the bits 3-0 must be set. Both must be a separate writes. NOTE: This bit cannot be set when bypess, encoder, decoder or 8b10b tests are performed.
When asserted, a corruption is injected at the interface of the internal diagnostic module which generate a fault in the 8b10b check of the FEC IP datapath for lanes 2 and 3. Bit is self cleared.

When asserted, a corruption is injected at the interface of the internal diagnostic module which generate a fault in the parity enc check of the FEC IP datapath for lanes 2 and 3. Bit is self cleared.

When asserted, a corruption is injected at the interface of the internal diagnostic module which generate a fault in the parity gen check of the FEC IP datapaths for lanes 2 and 3. Bit is self cleared.

When asserted, a corruption is injected at the interface of the internal diagnostic module which generate a fault in the bypass check for of the FEC IP datapathe for lanes 2 and 3. Bit is self cleared.
When asserted, a corruption is injected at the interface of the internal diagnostic module which generate a fault in the 8b10b check of the FEC IP datapath for lanes 0 and 1. Bit is self cleared.

When asserted, a corruption is injected at the interface of the internal diagnostic module which generate a fault in the parity enc check of the FEC IP datapath for lanes 0 and 1. Bit is self cleared.

When asserted, a corruption is injected at the interface of the internal diagnostic module which generate a fault in the parity gen check of the FEC IP datapath for lanes 0 and 1. Bit is self cleared.

When asserted, a corruption is injected at the interface of the internal diagnostic module which generate a fault in the bypass check for of the FEC IP datapath for lanes 0 and 1. Bit is self cleared.

No-video mode configuration bit. Relevant only in SST mode. When this bit is set high and framer is enabled then IP operates in no-video mode i.e. BS symbol is generated every 8192 link symbols. In this mode audio data can be transmitted.

Number of lanes: 0h - One lane [Lane 0 only] 1h - Two lanes [Lanes 0 and 1 only] 2h - Reserved 3h - Four lanes [Lanes 0, 1, 2, and 3]. This value can only be changed before link training and further it can by modified during link training in case link training for a given lane configuration fails. This field must not be changed after link training.

Allow the video FIFO to drain faster at end of line. This setting applies only to SST mode.

Number of valid symbols per Transfer Unit [TU]. Rounded down to lower integer value [refer to equation in DP specification]. Allowed values are 1 to [TU_size-1]. TU valid smaller than one that would result this register to be set to 0 are not supported by the IP. This setting applies only to SST mode.
Reserved. Writes are ignored. 0x0 when read.

Static debug register. Controls how often BS is replaced by SR in SST mode. Default value of 512 results in every 512th BS being replaced by SR as per DP spec. This register can only be changed for a test purposes in order to speed up BS-SR replacement.

This bit is used only in DP_OUT mode. If SET, a transaction that comes from the adapter will be sent immediately without waiting for send_external_transaction pulse. If CLEAR, the MC controls the traffic to/from the adapter.

According to the current standard the tx precharge is done by sending 10 to 16 data_0 on the line before the SYNC. Old standard define the precharge by forcing the AFE to be in precharge mode before transmitting the SYNC.
Normally, the aux_rx is disabled during transmit. Setting this bit allow loopback operation and all transmit transactions will go to the receiver. Used for debug purpose.

Enable automatics sub packet number. When enabled number of sub-packts will be set according to MEM FIFO number of samples.
0 - All packets behave the same. 1- First lpcm audio packet is sent with 1 - SP.

Number of channels to decode. 0: 1 channel 31: 32 channels
Reserved. Writes are ignored. 0x0 when read
0 - Normal Operation. 1 - I2S port 3 is disabled [user should ignore its outputs]. This allows for 24-ch, 12-ch, 6-ch transfer.
0 - Empty is a function of read address. 1 - Empty is a function of BASE read address.
0 - smpl2pkt [inc_step=number of I2S ports] 1 - pkt2smpl [inc_step=num_ch_per_port]
When high the last channel index synchronizes the write addresses [to the next channel group]
Resets Fifo's write and read pointers. When FIFO configuration bits change this signal should be high [due to synchronization issues].
Reserved. Writes are ignored. 0x0 when read
Indicates a FIFO underrun error has occured - FIFO read when it was empty. For debug purposes, not synchronized.
Indicates a FIFO overrun error has occured - FIFO written to when it was full. For debug purposes, not synchronized.
Indicates FIFO Empty. For debug purposes, not synchronized.
Indicates FIFO Full. For debug purposes, not synchronized.
Reserved. Writes are ignored. 0x0 when read
If number of samples in MEM FIFO is below Threshold 3: Each Packet will contain only 3 subpacket.
If number of samples in MEM FIFO is below Threshold2: Each Packet will contain only 2 subpacket.
If number of samples in MEM FIFO is below Threshold 1: Each Packet will contain only 1 subpacket.
Reserved. Writes are ignored. 0x0 when read

4 MSB of the packet memory address from which the data is read.
Reserved. Writes are ignored. 0x0 when read
Read request bit for the host read transaction, active high. Bit is automatically cleared when operation is completed.
The 32 bits of the data to be written to the packet memory. When written to this register fifo1_wr_enable will automatically be asserted and the data is stored in FIFO.
The 32 bits of the data to be read from the packet memory. When read from this register fifo2_rd_enable will automatically be asserted and the data is read from the FIFO.
Reserved. Writes are ignored. 0x0 when read
Fifo1 flush bit, active high. Bit is automatically cleared when operation is completed.

Fifo2 flush bit, active high. Bit is automatically cleared when operation is completed.
Reserved. Writes are ignored. 0x0 when read

Fifo1 full indication, when high indicates that FIFO1 is full
State of the FSM that controls packet memory transactions.

Fifo2 overflow indication. Indicates incorrect programming sequence. Active HIGH. Clear on read.
Fifo1 underflow indication. Indicates incorrect programming sequence. Active HIGH. Clear on read.
Fifo1 overflow indication. Indicates incorrect programming sequence. Active HIGH. Clear on read.
Error happened, invalid write to the allocation table. Indicates incorrect programming sequence. Active HIGH. Clear on read.
Successful write to the allocation table. Active HIGH. Clear on read.
Reserved field. 0x0 when read. Writes ignored.
Indication that nonvalid type of packet is requested by the packet interface. Indicates incorrect programming sequence. Active HIGH. Clear on read.
Indication that the host read transaction finished. Active HIGH. Clear on read.
Indication that the host write transaction finished. Active HIGH. Clear on read.
